entries.title: Drone Responsible for Iran Defense Ministry Blast: State TV
entries.description: A “heavy explosion” heard at an ammunition depot belonging to Iran’s Defense Ministry in the central Isfahan Province was caused by a drone attack, state TV reported early Sunday.

entries.title: Labour PM, Chancellor Would Publish Tax Returns, Starmer Says
entries.description: Sir Keir Starmer has said that under a Labour government, the prime minister, chancellor and deputy prime minister would all publish their tax returns.

entries.title: Peru’s President Blasts Congress’s Refusal to Expedite Elections
entries.description: Peru’s fragile government blasted Friday night’s decision by Congress not to bring forward presidential elections as political turmoil in the Andean nation continues into its eighth week.

entries.title: Boris Johnson Was Told to Stop Seeking Advice on Financial Matters: Report
entries.description: Boris Johnson was reportedly told to stop asking Richard Sharp for "advice" about his "personal financial matters", just days before Mr Sharp was announced as the new BBC chairman.

entries.title: Emhoff Calls for Fighting Anti-Jewish Tropes on Auschwitz Visit
entries.description: Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff’s emotional visit to Auschwitz-Birkenau marked something of a triumph for Jewish Americans: one of their own representing the US at the epicenter of the Nazi genocide that tried — but failed — to wipe out their people.

entries.title: Bolsonaro’s Son Dismisses Idea of Father’s Extradition by US
entries.description: The eldest son of former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Saturday that his father doesn’t have a deadline to return to Brazil and dismissed the idea of extradition by the US.

entries.title: US General Sees China War Risk for 2025 in Memo Cited by NBC
entries.description: An Air Force general said in an internal memo that the US and China risk going to war in two years and told officers under his command to prepare, including with target practice, NBC News reported.

entries.title: Welsh Government Announces ‘Sudden’ Death of First Minister’s Wife
entries.description: The wife of Wales' First Minister Mark Drakeford has died suddenly, the Welsh Government has confirmed.

entries.title: Under-Fire Ministers Should Stand Aside During Ethics Probes, Says Tory Peer
entries.description: A senior Tory peer and former Commons standards chair appeared to suggest that Nadhim Zahawi should step away from his Conservative Party role while the inquiry into his tax affairs continues.

entries.title: Ex-NATO General on Path to Win Czech Presidential Election
entries.description: A former NATO general pledging unwavering support for Ukraine was headed to victory in a runoff for the next Czech presidency, with preliminary results showing him with a solid lead over a billionaire former prime minister.

entries.title: British Army Member Accused of ‘Bomb Hoax’ and Terror Offence Appears in Court
entries.description: A 21-year-old serving member of the British Army accused of committing a "bomb hoax" and a terror offence at an RAF base has appeared in court.

entries.title: Your Saturday UK Briefing: Sunak’s Retreat; Hunt’s Hands Tied on Taxes
entries.description: Something for the weekend

entries.title: China Says Covid Deaths Fell Even as Lunar Holiday Spread Virus
entries.description: China reported a sharp drop in new Covid-related deaths during the Lunar New Year holiday, even as a spike in travel increased the likelihood of more infections across the country.

entries.title: Ukraine Gets Tanks to Repel Russia’s Invasion: Weekend Reads
entries.description: The US and Germany agreed to give Ukraine the modern NATO-standard battle tanks Kyiv has been requesting for months so that it can better defend and take back territory from Vladimir Putin’s invading troops.

entries.title: China Vows to Boost Consumption to Power Economic Recovery
entries.description: China’s State Council said the nation needs to accelerate a recovery in consumption and make it the main driving force of the economy, as the world’s second-largest economy emerges from three years of stringent Covid controls.

entries.title: Expect to See A Lot More of First Lady Jill Biden in 2024
entries.description: The first lady is likely to weigh in on major campaign decisions, including the biggest of them all: whether to run.

entries.title: Starmer Warns Against ‘Complacency’ But Says Labour Has ‘Changed’
entries.description: Sir Keir Starmer has offered a sober message to party members, warning that action against antisemitism can never cease as he positioned Labour as the party of "sound" money.

entries.title: Trump to Court Voters ‘Open to Dating’ Others in Early States
entries.description: Donald Trump heard people pan his speech when he announced his third presidential run back in November. Key political figures in all-important Iowa won’t return his calls. Now, he’s heading to find some of the old magic in New Hampshire and South Carolina.

entries.title: Nigerian Fiscal Pressures to Worsen Post Election, Moody’s Says
entries.description: Nigeria’s efforts to carry out urgent fiscal reforms will face “social and institutional constraints” even after a new president is elected next month, Moody’s Investors Service said in a report.

entries.title: Italy’s Meloni Visits Libya to Strengthen Energy, Migration Ties
entries.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is visiting Libyan capital Tripoli on Saturday, as part of an effort to bolster energy and migration ties with the north African country.

entries.title: Gulf Royals Own £1 Billion UK Property Via Tax Havens: Guardian
entries.description: Royal families of Gulf states such as Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Qatar own more than £1 billion ($1.2 billion) of UK real estate via offshore tax havens like Jersey and the British Virgin Islands, the Guardian newspaper reported.

entries.title: Finland Hints at Russian Involvement in Swedish Koran Burning
entries.description: Finland’s foreign minister hinted that Russia may have been involved in last week’s Koran-burning protest that threatens to derail Sweden’s accession to NATO.

entries.title: Staff at British Museum to Walk Out During Half-Term Break
entries.description: Fresh strikes have been called by the biggest civil service union in its long-running dispute over jobs, pay and pensions.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Slams IOC Over Paris Olympics Plan
entries.description: The Pentagon’s inspector-general met in Kyiv on Friday with Ukraine’s defense minister, days after at least 10 officials were ousted over corruption allegations and as Western weapons donations — and calls for accountability — pick up pace.

entries.title: Two Airforce Aircraft Collide Mid-Air in Central India
entries.description: Two Indian air force fighter aircraft collided mid-air in central India, according to an Indian government official with knowledge of the matter.

entries.title: EU Needs Funds to Counter US Energy Push: Here Are the Options
entries.description: The European Union is discussing how to boost its financial muscle to counter the US’s $369 billion green subsidy package and tackle costly challenges such as weaning itself off Russian energy and rebuilding Ukraine.

entries.title: China Celebrated Lunar New Year Like Covid No Longer Exists
entries.description: Tourist spots were swamped, movie theaters were packed and fireworks displays lit up the night sky as China celebrated the Lunar New Year with an abandon that marked the end of its three-year Covid Zero experiment.

entries.title: Police Bodycam Footage of Tyre Nichols Beating Released by Memphis Officials
entries.description: Officials in Memphis released police bodycam footage late Friday of the beating of Tyre Nichols, a Black man who died from injuries suffered during a traffic stop earlier this month.

entries.title: HMRC Admits Mistakes in Answering Zahawi Investigation Questions
entries.description: HM Revenue and Customs has come under scrutiny for providing misleading information last year after it said that no Government minister was under investigation, as the row over Nadhim Zahawi's tax affairs continues.

entries.title: Half of Britons Struggle With Soaring Cost of Running Households
entries.description: Almost half of people in Britain are struggling with a surge in the cost of running their household after inflation hit a four-decade high, a think tank warned.

entries.title: Tempers Flaring Over Onions Show Marcos Faces Risk on Prices
entries.description: Ferdinand Marcos Jr made a curious move when he became Philippine president-elect in mid-2022: he named himself agriculture minister, pledging to fix the country’s food problems.
